definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: specialists but no philosophers of human wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 只有專門家，而沒有人類知識的哲學家。

sentences.english: Our specialists in music should pay attention to the songs of the masses.
sentences.chinese: 我們的音樂專門家應該注意羣衆的歌唱。

sentences.english: Our specialists in drama should pay attention to the small troupes in the army and the villages.
sentences.chinese: 我們的戲劇專門家應該注意軍隊和農村中的小劇團。

sentences.english: Our specialists in the fine arts should pay attention to the fine arts of the masses.
sentences.chinese: 我們的美術專門家應該注大衆的美術。
